title: The Art of Living: Photography from the museum's permanent collection, 1840-1966
description: This exhibit was a unique show that featured over one-hundred interior design objects from around the world. All of the items featured were selected by Davis Allen, who was a designer at the Istanbul Hilton Hotel, the Mauna Kea Beach Hotel, and the Inland Steel Building. Additionally, seven interior designers and architects worked with seven hostesses to create rooms such as “The Collectors Room,” “My Room at the Top,” “Evening in Siam,” “Oriental Pavilion,” “A Quiet Room,” a room for “A Comfortable Gathering,” and “The Ivory Corner.” The Mrs. James Ward Thorne Miniature Rooms collection was incorporated into the exhibition as well, illustrating the art of living from the 14th century to the 1960s.

input: The Art of Living: Photography from the museum's permanent collection, 1840-1966
